intro: Thomsonaria ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty thomsonaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, rusty-colored pubescence. Thomsonaria ferruginea is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and adaptability to arid conditions.
